div.p: A345 Royal Park Zoological Society letter and minute book, p. 15-16, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter, dated 19th October,
G. Sprigg to M, 19 October 1864 (in this edition as 64-10-19a).
in reply to which I beg to inform you for communication to the Council of the Acclimation Society, that at a Meeting of the Trustees of the Royal Park held this day the byefollowing resolutions were passed

1. That the Trustees in accordance of the letter of the Chief Secretary of Octob. 20th
Letter not found. decide, that they can not in the exercise of their functions as Trustees of the Royal Park assent to the application of the Powder-Magazine as a temporary receptacle for Lunatics for transmission to the Lunatic-Asylum.

2. Nevertheless on the pressing necessity of the case, and conditionally upon the assurance of the Governm. being given to them of their intention to arrange as speedily as possible for some other provision for the purpose, the Trustees feel as a matter of humanity that they ought not to offer any opposition to the proposition, but content themselves with recording their protest against any other than a temporary use of any portion of the Royal Park for such purpose.
A345 Royal Park Zoological Society minute book, pp. 139-40, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney. See also M to J. McCulloch, 21 October 1864 (in this edition as 64-10-21a).
